Description: Rim fragment of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery column-krater; edge of rim black; on the top, multiple zig-zag frieze bounded, presumably near handle attachment, by double diagonal line. The exterior surface of the bowl is destroyed, the interior glazed black with an added red band (0.5 cm) below the rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 78 no. 262 pl. 59)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0956)
